name: places/ChIJmcYZPHVZwokRbCBBBMgfnQg
formattedAddress: 351 E 18th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 351 E 18th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
Beware of this irresponsible, unacceptable vendor.

I live next door in StuyTown, and so using them occasionally. This week have spent ~$50 in laundry (wash and dry) + Dry Cleaning of 6 shirts. To my shock, one of my favorite shirts (one I used for my sister's wedding) came completely torn apart. Not a little hole, but completely torn as if a dog cut it all over for an hour. To my shock, the store did not accept responsibility, blamed "their own vendor" and claimed for a minute even that this is how I brought the shirt (as, of course, a reasonable man would wish to pay money to dry clean a torn apart buttoned down shirt, totally sensible).

After pushing and escalating - they offered a $30 compensation, the cost of a NYC Burger, for my $180 shirt they destroyed and refused to discuss further.

This is a shameful business practice, lacking basic decency and responsibility. Their handling was insulting, rude and their attempt to blame the customer in such a clear situation is beyond absurd.

I won't be back before they'll make things right with their customers and claim responsibility.

***update: a manager contacted and offered compensation in the form of a store credit; certainly not a full compensation - but it‚Äôs a step in the right direction ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è***

originalText.text: I've been using Prestige for about a year now, and it has literally changed my life! The owner is super nice, accommodating and very responsive.  Love that they pick-up and drop-off, same day!  Clothes are always well folded, and smell clean and fresh.  Their drivers are also courteous and professional.  If you don't have a washer/dryer at home and you want to get back 8 hours of your life every month - trust Prestige to take care of it for you.

text.text: I've been using Prestige for about a year now, and it has literally changed my life! The owner is super nice, accommodating and very responsive.  Love that they pick-up and drop-off, same day!  Clothes are always well folded, and smell clean and fresh.  Their drivers are also courteous and professional.  If you don't have a washer/dryer at home and you want to get back 8 hours of your life every month - trust Prestige to take care of it for you.

originalText.text:
Do yourself a favor and visit any other laundry place in the neighborhood. Unfortunately, I had a very bad experience where they completely ripped me off and charged me twice for items I had already paid for. This was a significant cost also because I had to have a number of clothes dry cleaned. They will blame their co-workers saying they didn't charge you properly, or state you dropped laundry off at different times (when you know that is false) claiming they got confused and only charged you part of the load. Oh and be very wary when they ask you to write your credit card details on a post-it note and leave it with them!! I strongly suggest using one of the many other laundry services in the area; I've never written a review like this before but my experience unfortunately warranted it. Happy washing!

The reply just posted from the owner (about 3 years after the event lol) just shows how bad this business is. Not only was he unprofessional in revealing our personal circumstances but he has completely lied - of course we had all our clothes rightly sealed in large bags - white, not black bags as if that makes any difference! We didn‚Äôt drop them off all in one go because it was 3 girls wardrobes so forgive us if we don‚Äôt have a inspector Gadget arms to carry all at once. Again, this business is full of excuses and lies and to this day no apology and never returned all the extra money taken from us. As mentioned above, I rarely write reviews but this was such an unpleasant experience that i want to save others the pain.

originalText.text: Just moved to the neighborhood 6 months ago and found this cleaner a block away. Continually sent shirts back to me with the buttons cracked or split in half.  (This had happened once or twice at my old cleaner and they would just take it upon themselves to sew another button on before I even picked up my shirts). Not here. I had at least 8 or so shirts with multiple cracked collar or sleeve buttons and asked them if they can replace any they broke this go round. And they said they can replace buttons but at an additional charge per button. Even though they keep breaking them. I told them to close my account and walked out. And they let me. Terrible customer service.

Terrible customer service.

originalText.text:
Summary: don't send anything that you care about for laundry or dry-cleaning here. In particular if it's expensive. They'll ruin it and just say "sue me".

We had been doing business with Prestige for about 6 months, a mix of laundry and dry-cleaning. We never had many issues with their laundry (except for the frequent sock missing its pair and the 2h wait for pickup/delivery), but things took a strong turn for the worse when we sent them a couple of ski jackets for washing.

One of the jackets was used and the other one was brand new. They both had clear instructions on their labels for machine washing and tumble dry. We sent them alongside our usual laundry without any special instructions for dry cleaning (since they shouldn't be dry cleaned!).

When we got them back, they charged us $15/each for dry cleaning! They didn't even bother reading the washing instructions on the labels. The used one came back okay but the new one came back smelling like a wet dog - a really strong, foul smell. We went back and forth for *2 weeks* (!) about this jacket, with various excuses through the process: "it's the material of these new ski jackets", "it needs to be air dried instead of tumble dry" and eventually ending up at "we don't smell anything bad". We tried to argue with them that this was a brand new jacket that was now unusable, but they said there wasn't much more they could do. At the end of the 2nd week, we had a long argument at the store, and the guy (owner?) eventually said "either you let us keep dry cleaning / washing it or you just sue us". It had been two weeks and we had no intention of leaving the jacket there with them.

At no point there was an apology. At no point there was an offer to pay for the ruined jacket - not even for a fraction of it. Even worse and more offensive, at the end he started acting like the jacket wasn't smelling bad at all (something he had admitted to previously), like we were making the smell up.

All in all this was a terrible experience. We will not return, we do not recommend. There are plenty of better laundry options in the neighborhood, there's no need to use someone that will screw up your brand new jacket and just say "sue me".
